title: How to Set Formal Silverware

steps.headline: Find a table where everyone will eat.
Position a dinner plate within an inch from the edge of the table and centered in front of each seat.
Place a salad plate on top of the dinner plate.
Place a soup bowl directly on top of your salad plate.
Set a table knife about half an inch to the right of the dinner plate.
steps.description: The blade should face the plate.

steps.headline: Place a salad knife to the right of the table knife.
Place a soup spoon to the right of the salad knife.
Place a dinner fork to the left of the dinner plate.
Place a salad fork to the left of the dinner fork.
steps.description: If you do not plan on serving fish, skip step 6.

steps.headline: Set a fish fork  to the left of your salad fork.
Place a napkin to the left of the salad fork.
Place a bread plate about and inch behind the forks towards the center of the table.
Place a butter knife on top of the bread plate.
Place a dessert fork about an inch behind the dinner plate.
steps.description: The prongs of the fork should be pointing to the right side of the table.

steps.headline: Place a dessert spoon behind the dessert fork.
steps.description: The bowl of the spoon should be pointed towards the left side of the table.

steps.headline: Place a water goblet, red wine glass, and white wine glass about 1–2 inches (2.5–5.1 cm) behind your knives and spoon in a diagonal pattern.

text: Getting Started Find a table where everyone will eat.  Position a dinner plate within an inch from the edge of the table and centered in front of each seat.  Place a salad plate on top of the dinner plate.  Place a soup bowl directly on top of your salad plate.  Setting the Main Silverware Set a table knife about half an inch to the right of the dinner plate. The blade should face the plate. Place a salad knife to the right of the table knife.  Place a soup spoon to the right of the salad knife.  Place a dinner fork to the left of the dinner plate.  Place a salad fork to the left of the dinner fork. If you do not plan on serving fish, skip step 6. Set a fish fork  to the left of your salad fork.  Place a napkin to the left of the salad fork.  Finishing the Final Section Place a bread plate about and inch behind the forks towards the center of the table.  Place a butter knife on top of the bread plate.  Place a dessert fork about an inch behind the dinner plate. The prongs of the fork should be pointing to the right side of the table. Place a dessert spoon behind the dessert fork. The bowl of the spoon should be pointed towards the left side of the table. Place a water goblet, red wine glass, and white wine glass about 1–2 inches (2.5–5.1 cm) behind your knives and spoon in a diagonal pattern.
